instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1534: What is A1534? A1534 is a model number for a 12 inch size Macbook  from years 2015, 2016 with EMC 2746, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00045, 820-00244..
definitions.820-00687: What is 820-00687? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00687</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1534</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 2017
threads.message:
hi to all, I have this motherboard with a problem that it does not turn on. I have tested the charging and battery connector and with another board it works perfectly. In the power pad I don't have 3.3v.

the history is it worked fine but from one day to the next it did not turn on again (this was a week ago)

Any help to know what measures to take and diagnose? I would like to know if it has a short or the CPU is dead.

thx u

edit: Sorry I was testing a new connector, in case it helps, the original usb-c connector doesn't work in case this damage could have caused a short on the board

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00687</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1534</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 2017
threads.message:
Check diode mode to ground on J9600 pins.
Compare readings with good board.

If USB-C connector was bad, you may have damaged <CHIP>U3100</CHIP>, or even CPU.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00687</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1534</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 2017
threads.message:
hi again:

Point 21, 19, 17, I have value 700, 690, 701 at bad board, but with good board I have 1400, 1396, 1405

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00687</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1534</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 2017
threads.message:
Did you check both boards with red probe connected to ground?
Also check without USB-C flex connected.
There are some components placed on the flex.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00687</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1534</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 2017
threads.message:
Did you check both boards with red probe connected to ground? no sorry with black.

with red:

                   bad board     |  good board
Point 21:          590                       590
Point 19:          560                       486
Point 17:          470                       599
Point 15:          480                       353
Point 13:          360.                      354
Point 11:          500.                      606
Point 9:            470                       597
Point 7:             470                      470
Point 5:             470                      470



omg sorry I'm confuse, but I check this to J9600 connector of board without usb-c flex.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00687</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1534</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 2017
threads.message:
15, 17 and 19 go to <CHIP>U3100</CHIP>.
You can change it, just to see if these values go better.

Pins 9 1 & 11 go directly to PCH/CPU; bad news.
The board may be trash now...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00687</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1534</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 2017
threads.message: I have two boards to get this IC <CHIP>U3100</CHIP> both with SSD problem, I have doubts which is better...
